issue.title: [Bug Report] SSR v-responsive

labels.name: upstream
labels.description: Problem with a third party library that we may have to work around

issue.body: ### Versions and Environment **Vuetify:** 1.3.15 **Vue:** 2.5.17 **Browsers:** Firefox 64.0 **OS:** Windows 10 ### Steps to reproduce Use v-responsive component and specify just height (for example) ### Expected Behavior getting just style property of specified properties and not all other property with undefined ### Actual Behavior See source code of codesandbox ### Reproduction Link https://codesandbox.io/s/o95x14r0xz

issue.title: vue-server-renderer: falsy styles are not filtered

repository.name: vue
repository.description: This is the repo for Vue 2. For Vue 3, go to https://github.com/vuejs/core

issue.body:
### Version 2.5.21 ### Reproduction link [https://github.com/manniL/vue-server-renderer-falsy-styles-bug/](https://github.com/manniL/vue-server-renderer-falsy-styles-bug/) ### Steps to reproduce 1. Clone repo 2. Install deps 3. Run `src/index.js` ### What is expected? `

Welcome!!

` ### What is actually happening? `

Welcome!!

` ### Related https://github.com/nuxt/nuxt.js/issues/4652

issue.title: filter illegal style
issue.body:
### What problem does this feature solve? fix inconsistent style in vue vs nuxt. This template: `

Welcome!

` will render in vue: `

Welcome!

` But render in nuxt:`

Welcome!

` In fact, in the development environment, after the `js` is rendered again, the filtered html can also be obtained. Unfortunately, in the production environment we get html that does not filter illegal values.
This feature request is available on Nuxt community (#c8381)

issue.title: v-bind not update dom in client side when data in client side is different from the server side

repository.name: vue
repository.description: This is the repo for Vue 2. For Vue 3, go to https://github.com/vuejs/core

issue.body:
### Version 2.6.10 ### Reproduction link [https://github.com/maunier/nuxt-learning](https://github.com/maunier/nuxt-learning) ### Steps to reproduce npm install npm run dev http://127.0.0.1:8080/ ### What is expected? i expect the div is like this: ```
isClient
``` ### What is actually happening? but now it is: ```
isClient
``` --- it is not Nuxt's issue, I have tested in my own vue-ssr server without Nuxt, the problem is exsist still. but the that project is not on the github, so i paste the nuxt project's link here the core code is like this: ```
{{ text }}
``` ``` data () { return { text: '' } }, created () { this.text = Vue.prototype.$isServer ? 'isServer' : 'isClient' }, ```

issue.title: [Bug Report] Vuetify textarea mishandling null/undefined input on SSR (Nuxt)

labels.name: T: bug
labels.description: Functionality that does not work as intended/expected

labels.name: upstream
labels.description: Problem with a third party library that we may have to work around

issue.body: ### Environment **Vuetify Version:** 2.1.9 **Vue Version:** 2.6.10 **Browsers:** Chrome 78.0.3904.70 **OS:** Linux x86_64 ### Steps to reproduce Set text area to a value of null/undefined and render component using SSR mode. ### Expected Behavior Would expect null/undefined values to be not stringified and set as internal value. ### Actual Behavior null/undefined values appear to be stringified and set as initial value in SSR mode. ### Reproduction Link https://codesandbox.io/s/codesandbox-nuxt-vdcv8 ### Other comments This is limited to how Vue is interacting w/ Nuxt SSR from what I can tell, originally I thought this was a Nuxt issue but they told me it isn't and to file it here instead. (https://github.com/nuxt/nuxt.js/issues/6639) If I wrap the v-textarea component in client-only the problem disappears, definitely a SSR issue.
